content.question: The graph above shows the electric field <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of an electromagnetic wave as a function of position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at a particular instant. Which of the following equations, where all quantities are assumed to have units consistent with the graph, best represents the graph?

choices.label: <math alttext="E equals, 10 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi x over 10, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E equals, 10 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi x over 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E equals, 5 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi x over 10, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E equals, 5 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi x over 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E equals, 5 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi x over 10, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 14.1: Properties of Wave Pulses and Waves

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
